description: A Pakistani man was arrested in Canada this week for plotting a mass shooting at a Jewish center in Brooklyn on the one-year anniversary of the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, federal authorities announced.
title: Man charged with plotting shooting at a Jewish center on anniversary of Hamas attack

description: There has been nearly a week of protests in Israel following the death of six hostages held by Hamas. They're calling on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to agree to a ceasefire deal with Hamas, bringing the remining hostages held in Gaza home. But so far, no deal has been reached. We talk about how Israelis view their prime minister with Anshel Pfeffer, correspondent for The Economist and author of a biography of Netanyahu.
title: Is Netanyahu an Obstacle to a Ceasefire Deal Between Israel and Hamas?

description: A New York judge agreed to delay the sentencing of former President Donald Trump in a criminal hush money case.
title: Trump gets criminal sentencing delayed till after presidential election

description: There was both good news — and bad news — in the latest jobs report, providing an unclear picture as the Federal Reserve  weighs how much to cut interest rates.
title: The latest jobs data provides a really confusing picture. Here are 4 things to know

description: Maykol Fares embarked on a perilous journey to ask for asylum in the US. Now he faces a new test of courage: the Merry-Go-Round.
title: 8-year-old tames (wooden) lion in Queens, New York

description: China's Foreign Ministry says the only exception will be for families who are adopting the children or stepchildren of blood relatives in China.
title: China ends most international adoptions, leaving many children, families in limbo

description: Climate change is affecting our food, and our food is affecting the climate. NPR is dedicating a week to stories and conversations about the search for solutions, from how we farm to what we cook to reducing food waste.
title: Climate Solutions Week: The future of food

description: The restaurant chain announced Thursday that it received approval for its Chapter 11 plan, offering a glimmer of good news for the business, which has faced a series of struggles
title: Red Lobster off the hook? Federal judge approves restructuring plan

description: The drug companies behind blockbuster weight loss and diabetes treatments have signaled that supply problems could soon be over, but many patients still have trouble getting the medicines.
title: Drugmakers say obesity medicine shortages are easing, but patients struggle to fill prescriptions

description: Gisèle Pélicot detailed the horror of discovering that her former spouse had systematically filmed the dozens of suspected rapes — storing thousands of images that police investigators later found.
title: A French woman whose husband is accused of inviting men to rape her testifies in court

description: Husam Abukhedeir, the chief neurosurgeon at Al-Shifa Hospital, helped the injured, watched many died, including his sister, then knew what he had to do to protect his family. How is he faring today?
title: Whatever happened to ... the Gaza neurosurgeon who faced a wrenching decision

description: Ali Truwit's lower leg was amputated after a shark bit her during a post-graduation trip last May. This week, she won Paralympic silver and set a new American record in the women's 400 meter free S10.
title: Ali Truwit swims to Paralympic silver a year after losing her leg in a shark attack

description: Check your receipt. Grow your own veggies. Ask about senior discounts. NPR readers share their top tips on cutting costs at the grocery store.
title: 10 more clever and commonsense ways to save money on groceries

description: The middle school winner of NPR’s Student Podcast Challenge tells how her golden retriever, Lopez, helped restore her independence.
title: Lilla Lanivich, 14, of Rochester Hills, Mich., wins NPR podcast contest

description: To target the tiny prey they depend on, humpbacks have developed a way of trapping them with nets made out of bubbles. A new study shows exactly how they do it.
title: Humpback whales make custom fishing nets – out of bubbles

description: There are fears that the death toll may rise, police said, as President William Ruto called the news “devastating.”
title: A fire at a school dormitory in Kenya kills at least 17 students

description: LL Cool J is out with his first album in over a decade. He says on Morning Edition, "I've been here for years, baby. How are you going to call it a comeback?"
title: LL Cool J goes back to his roots in his new album

description: The middle school winner of NPR's Student Podcast Challenge tells how her golden retriever, Lopez, changed her life.
title: Chronic illness shattered this teen's life. Her service dog helped get it back

description: Queens of the chart, field and Maori adorn the quiz this week, and we also address seasonal topics like memoirs and TV shows. Enjoy it while you can!
title: Which high-profile Republican says they are voting for Harris? Find out in the quiz

description: For some people, 1-day topical treatments for yeast infections can cause their own irritation. And some doctors steer their patients away from the 1-day options — which contain 12 times the medicine of the 7-day treatment.
title: Yeast infections are miserable. And some over-the-counter treatments can backfire

description: The tech billionaire breaks his silence more than a week after being indicted by French authorities. He faces wide-ranging charges including spreading child abuse images and drug trafficking.
title: Telegram founder breaks silence, calling charges 'misguided'
